{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.09954v1", "title": "Romanoff's theorem and sums of two squares", "summary": "Let $A=\{a_{n}\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ and $B=\{b_{n}\}_{n=1}^{\infty}$ be two
sequences of positive integers. Under some restrictions on $A$ and $B$, we
obtain a lower bound for a number of integers $n$ not exceeding $x$ that can be
expressed as a sum $n = a_i + b_j$. In particular, we obtain the result in the
case when $A$ is the set of numbers representable as the sum of two squares.", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT", "published": "2025-04-14T07:33:30Z"}
